scenarioDescription:
The K2-358 Exoplanetary System


Overview

K2-358 is a star with 0.93 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.91 times its radius. It is located 1566.55 light years away from the solar system.

K2-358 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the K2-358 system


K2-358 b

K2-358 b was discovered by the K2 observatory, in 2021-09, using the transit method. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of K2-358 b is 7.664 times the mass of Earth. The radius of K2-358 b is 2.680 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, K2-358 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system K2-358, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the K2.
name: K2-358 - System With 1 Exoplanet
